intro: Moraea cedarmontana, commonly known as the cedar mountain moraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces tall, upright stems with clustered blooms. Moraea cedarmontana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
